newsitem.title: USA: Plains feedlot cattle bid $68, no trade - private.
newsitem.headline: Plains feedlot cattle bid $68, no trade - private.

text.p: Plains feedlot cattle continued to be bid $68.00 per cwt, but feedlots passed and kept asking prices at $69.00 to $70.00, sources said.

Most cattle sold last week have been delivered to meat packers. However, one meat packer cancelled shipment of several pens and instructed those cattle remain at the feedlot another week, at the packer's expense. Sources speculated last week's active sales, plus the receiving of contract cattle and CME deliveries, fulfilled the packer's near-term needs.
Feedlots are current and some managers said they could wait until next week to sell cattle.
In the Texas panhandle, feedlot sources reported recent rainfall was beneficial for winter wheat planting, which should begin soon. The rain also settled dust in the feedlots.
